meanings.definition: The act of hitting someone or something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The bully's batterings left bruises on the victim.
meanings.sent2: The batterings of the storm damaged the roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: The batterings from the overenthusiastic high-five game were getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The batterings of criticism from his boss were hard to bear.
meanings.sent5: The batterings of the waves against the shore sounded like a drumbeat.

meanings.definition: A series of heavy blows or strikes.
meanings.sent1: The batterings of the boxer were powerful and relentless.
meanings.sent2: The batterings of the hammer on the metal echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The batterings of the rain on the window made a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The batterings of bad luck seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The batterings of the drums set the pace for the dancers.

meanings.definition: The process of coating food in a mixture of flour and liquid before cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chef's batterings of the fish made it crispy and delicious.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for batterings of the chicken before frying.
meanings.sent3: The playful batterings of flour in the kitchen turned into a messy food fight.
meanings.sent4: The secret to the perfect tempura lies in the light batterings.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the fresh batterings filled the kitchen with anticipation.
